column1:
Your_Future_President,"2019-03-22T15:06:26.08Z","Superb Value!...if you get it on sale...","

Going into this set I was really looking forward to it. I found it on sale at Walmart for $25, which I find a pretty good price, but it still doesn&rsquo
column2: t even out the ppp to 10 cents, which I believe is the mark of an overpriced set. But it looks cool from the outside so let&rsquo
column3: s take a look at the contents.&nbsp

column2: for me was the best minifigure of this set&mdash
column4: t say much considering there are only two. His body is found in a couple other sets, and his head is also only found in the Rexplorer set. So he&rsquo
column5: s not that common. (Definitely not as common as Emmet). &nbsp
column6: He comes with a coffee cup for an accessory, which is rextremely&nbsp
column7: disappointing as a gun could have been easily included.&nbsp

column1: Emmet is not different from any other Emmets in the line apart from his head, which, though not exclusive, is rarer than his
column2: commonplace body is.&nbsp

column1: Lets start with the Dino. The Dino itself is great. He has a blue patch over one eye
column2: he also appears in the Rexplorer&nbsp
column4: s not different than any other raptors except of course his color.&nbsp

column1: Now his pack leaves much to be desired. If you build it according to the instructions. The main gun (that goes over his head) is off center which, although easily fixable, seems quite odd. Also, on the sides, there are a bunch of unsightly studs that could have EASILY been covered up by some slopes or plates. It looks somewhat...unfinished.

column2: looks nice for a little alien. It includes several nice pieces which are recolors&nbsp
column3: as well as sparkly purple pieces. For this price I think two similar designs could have been included.

column1: Now onto the vehicle. While looking quite nice in the pictures, the end product is quite...small. There are points where ugly studs are visible which, like the Dino, could have been covered by plates or tiles. The rotating guns in the back work quite nicely, but are very loose unless you push everything together very firmly.
column2: These can be removed and given to Rex as hand held guns, but it looks more like he&rsquo
column3: s waving a banner for his favorite sports team than trying to shoot the plantimal.&nbsp
column5: The slanted bumper was a neat idea but looks two dimensional, as it doesn&rsquo
column6: t even have headlights. One interesting thing is that in a set full a stickers, one piece is printed with Rex&rsquo
column9: which I found interesting, although quite unnecessary. But still a nice addition.&nbsp
column10: Overall a sturdy build though, and a fun one at that.&nbsp

column1: Several extra pieces seem to just be stuck randomly on the vehicle to provide building opportunities for two other creations. Both of which are vastly inferior to the main build. I would not recommend you wasting your time on them, unless of course they really really appeal to you. If so that&rsquo
column2: s fine.&nbsp
&nbsp

column1: I know that having a dinosaur in a set increases the price, as they are more expensive to make, but even so, this seems very overpriced and undersized. Don&rsquo
column2: t take all my criticism as that I despise the set&mdash
column3: I like it very well, and had I to&nbsp
column4: do it over again I would get it again. But the designers could have put a couple plates and slopes here and there to really beef it up. Also another plantimal or gun for Rex might have been nice too. Well I guess that&rsquo
column5: s about it. Thank you for your time!

column1:
,TRUE,4,4,5,4,4 PerryThePlatypus","2020-09-22T17:54:58.36Z","A Good but Rex-pensive set","

Forgive my mediocre pun. 1 year ago today, I went to my local comic-con for my birthday and won this set for free at a building competition, I picked this set as my prize (even though it looked like one of the weaker sets of the Lego Movie 2 wave to me at first glance) since the other sets didn&rsquo
column2: t particularly interest me and I was excited to get my first Lego (adult) Raptor and I like the Lego Movie 2 theme anyway.&nbsp

column1: The Off-Roader: So, is this just another Lego vehicle we&rsquo
column2: ve seen many times before? ...kinda. It doesn&rsquo
column4: s many things unique about the vehicle that we haven&rsquo
column6: s nice pieces and a good color scheme on it for sure. The right side of the vehicle uses a couple of bright yellowish green pieces (also using a sticker) and it also has a printed Rex symbol element that only other appears in Emmet&rsquo
column7: s Dream House, so nice inclusion here. The other side of the vehicle has the main dark blue color and it also has a 2 by 4 tile with a sticker of the Rex symbol on there and that just adds a little bit of detail. 2 seats are provided for our figures of the set, one to drive and the other... to be a copilot I guess, with a sticker in front of it of what seems to be some control panels. In between the seats is a little space to put Rex&rsquo
column8: s briefcase and I really liked that feature. A third seat is provided at the back of the vehicle so that you could seat another figure at the gunning position, it has a sticker on a 1 by 2 tile in front of it that&rsquo
column9: s a radar detecting incoming enemies, I really liked the inclusion of the third seating spot. As for the twin cannons, they look pretty cool, both have stickers of little arrows which could be seen as unnecessary to some. These cannons have 2 play features with one being a stud shooter and the other is the ability to rotate both of them simultaneously by turning a gear at the bottom, it was a very simple but clever play feature and I definitely like the way it was executed. Overall, it turned out better than I expected, but still nothing too special. I do like it though since it has things that are really great about it, such as the&nbsp
column10: 3 spaces for minifigs, the awesome rotating twin cannon play feature and a space to store the briefcase which I really think Lego should implement more storage spaces for minifig accessories in vehicles. So definitely a solid build overall.

column1: Rexecusaurus: Lego officially refers to this build as &ldquo
column2: Execu-Rex-o-saurus&rdquo
column4: ve EASILY been called Rexecusaurus. Anyway this alternate build uses very little pieces from the off-roader and it&rsquo
column5: s basically just the raptor but with robo arms and a saddle on her. Yeah, this build is just meh, definitely the weakest build of the 3.

column1: Raptor Car: This build that Lego calls &ldquo
column2: Rex-o-saurus Quad&rdquo
column5: is one of the 2 alternate builds of the set and it&rsquo
column6: s actually pretty good, which I think is ALMOST as good as the off-roader. This build is the raptor but with his limbs replaced with vehicle parts, with&nbsp
column7: stud shooters on the side, a seat for a figure and the dino now&nbsp
column9: s honestly an un ironically great vehicle, it perfectly resembles the fun and wackiness of Lego Movie sets and it&rsquo
column10: s definitely fun to play around with.

column1: Plantimal: The build for the plantimal is pretty clever and I really like the use of specific pieces on it like the crab in lavender, some pieces with glitter in it, foliage elements and the 1 by 1 circular eye prints. Overall, it works very well as a colorful and unique looking enemy in the set and I wish there was at least a second one included in the set.
Rex: The obvious better figure of the set is Rex, mainly because he&rsquo
column2: s less common than Emmet. His legs have some black knee pads on there and a belt on the hip, simple but nice detailing. His torso has his dark blue vest with the reflective lines and a Rex symbol printed on the front and back of the torso. His arms have some dark blue cuffs printed on them, and I always love it when there&rsquo
column3: s arm printing in sets outside of CMFs. His face prints have a smile and an angry gritted teeth face, both with his super manly stubbles and chiseled features previously hidden under baby fat! *wink. Those face prints only other come in Rex&rsquo
column4: s Rexplorer, so another nice inclusion in the set. His hair piece was made for this character and I really like the&nbsp
column6: s pretty impressive and I hope Lego recolors&nbsp
column7: this hair piece more in the future. Finally, his accessories is a white mug and a black briefcase. Overall, a nice figure.

column2: t really mind getting so many of him though, but I can understand the frustration for some. His legs are the scratched up reflective lines and his name tag on there. His torso is his usual orange vest with the scratched up reflective lines. His face is an open smile and scared face that only other appears in the Ultrakatty set, so I like the inclusion of these expressions here. His hair is just the usual. Finally, his accessory is a flashlight. So it&rsquo
column3: s just another Emmet, but I still like the figure itself and the face print is a pretty uncommon one.

column2: t know in what part of the review the raptor should be put in, so I just put her in the Minifig section. This Raptor is easily the best part of the set, probably for me personally since it&rsquo
column3: s my first and only Lego adult dinosaur, this identical design of the dinosaur also appears in Rex&rsquo
column4: s Rexplorer, so I appreciate the cheaper alternative way to get it. So this has the functions of any other Lego raptor as you would expect, with movable arms and legs, a jaw that can snap open and close as well as the rubber tail. Some amazing printing of blue patterns can be found on the legs, body, tail and head. The printing on&nbsp
column5: it looks really awesome and they help make this raptor look very unique compared to others. A built up gun is attached to the 4 studs on the raptor&rsquo
column6: s body, the gun could be adjusted up and down and there are&nbsp
column7: stud shooters attached at each side of the build. Overall, this raptor is amazing and I&rsquo
column8: m really glad to own it.

column1: The price was the main thing that kept me from buying this set (aside from thinking it wouldn&rsquo
column2: t be a unique set). 30 dollars doesn&rsquo
column3: t really feel worth it to me. I know there&rsquo
column4: s a raptor included and that producing it is more expensive and it&rsquo
column5: s probably why the set is priced at 30 bucks, but if you ask me, I only see 20 or 25 bucks worth of stuff here. While the main build is good, it doesn&rsquo
column7: s big enough for the price, unlike the Ultrakatty and Warrior Lucy set, but to be fair, it isn&rsquo
column9: s definitely other sets out there with a worse value.&nbsp
column11: s one of those sets that I wouldn&rsquo
column13: t mind getting for free or as a gift, luckily for me, I won it for free.

column2: t expect much from this set in general, but I was wrong about the off-roader, it wasn&rsquo
column3: t as bland of a vehicle as I thought it would be. 1 of the 2 alternate builds are great, the raptor is amazing and the minifigures are pretty good. Unfortunately, the value of the set weighs it down for me, it&rsquo
column4: s just one of those set that I wouldn&rsquo
column5: t pay full price for. With all that said, I still think this is a pretty good set and I&#39
column9: recommend it to any fan of the Lego Movies or if you want a (sort of) cheap way to get that amazing Raptor.
